TITLE: Implementing Custom Scheduling Adapter in JavaScript for Ghost DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create a custom scheduling adapter for Ghost. It includes the basic structure and required functions that need to be implemented, such as schedule, reschedule, and unschedule. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/custom-schedulers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var util = require('util'); // If this require does not work, then your content folder structure is different // So change the require path so that your adapter can import the scheduling base. var SchedulingBase = require('../../core/server/adapters/scheduling/SchedulingBase'); function MyAdapter(options) { SchedulingBase.call(this, options); } util.inherits(MyAdapter, SchedulingBase); // required functions you need to implement MyAdapter.prototype.schedule = function(object) { // when the job should be executed (time is a UTC timestamp) var time = object.time; // the url you need to execute when the time is reached var url = object.url; // the HTTP method you need to use var httpMethod = object.extra.httpMethod; }; MyAdapter.prototype.reschedule = function(object) { // see MyAdapter.prototype.schedule // the time when the url was scheduled before (oldTime is a UTC timestamp) var oldTime = object.extra.oldTime; }; MyAdapter.prototype.unschedule = function(object) { // see MyAdapter.prototype.schedule }; //this function is called on server bootstrap MyAdapter.prototype.run = function() {}; module.exports = MyAdapter; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Required Storage Adapter Methods in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Complete implementation template for a custom storage adapter in Ghost. This code defines all five required methods that must be implemented: exists, save, serve, delete, and read. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/storage-adapters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` 'use strict'; var BaseAdapter = require('ghost-storage-base'); class MyCustomAdapter extends BaseAdapter{ constructor() { super(); } exists() { } save() { } serve() { return function customServe(req, res, next) { next(); } } delete() { } read() { } } module.exports = MyCustomAdapter; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Storage Adapter Class in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Base implementation of a custom storage adapter for Ghost. This code shows how to inherit from the base adapter class and includes skeleton implementations of the five required methods: exists, save, serve, delete, and read. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/storage-adapters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` 'use strict'; var BaseAdapter = require('ghost-storage-base'); class MyCustomAdapter extends BaseAdapter{ constructor() { super(); } } module.exports = MyCustomAdapter; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ghost-CLI via NPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Ghost command line interface globally using npm package manager SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/local.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install ghost-cli@latest -g ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Ghost Content API Post Object DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the structure of a post object as returned by the Ghost Content API. It shows all the standard fields including title, slug, HTML content, feature image, and associated metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/posts.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "posts": [ { "id": "5ddc9141c35e7700383b280d", "uuid": "a5aa9bd5-fc23-4e5f-b268-908fb4d9baa4", "title": "Welcome to Ghost", "slug": "welcome", "html": "

👋 Welcome, it's great to have you here.

We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial getting started posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time. This is the first one!

A few things you should know upfront:

  1. Ghost is designed for ambitious, professional publishers who want to actively build a business around their content. That's who it works best for.
  2. The entire platform can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It's very powerful, but does require some knowledge of code. Ghost is not necessarily a good platform for beginners or people who just want a simple personal blog.
  3. For the best experience we recommend downloading the Ghost Desktop App for your computer, which is the best way to access your Ghost site on a desktop device.

Ghost is made by an independent non-profit organisation called the Ghost Foundation. We are 100% self funded by revenue from our Ghost(Pro) service, and every penny we make is re-invested into funding further development of free, open source technology for modern publishing.

The version of Ghost you are looking at is the latest release. You can always check what's new in the release notes, and we regularly publish new tutorials and updates on our blog.

The main thing you'll want to read about next is probably: Organising your content.

Or you might want to learn about how to set up your team.

You can also explore the full Ghost demo site, which contains a range of helpful info.

structure of an author object as returned by the Ghost Content API. It includes various properties such as ID, name, profile image, cover image, bio, website, location, and social media links. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/users.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "authors": [ { "id": "1", "name": "Ghost", "slug": "ghost", "profile_image": "https://demo.ghost.io/content/images/2019/03/ghost-icon.png", "cover_image": "https://demo.ghost.io/content/images/2019/03/ghost-cover.png", "bio": "The professional publishing platform", "website": "https://ghost.org", "location": "The Internet", "facebook": "ghost", "twitter": "@ghost", "meta_title": null, "meta_description": null, "url": "https://demo.ghost.io/author/ghost/" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Tag Object from Ghost Content API DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the structure of a tag object as returned by the Ghost Content API. It includes properties like id, name, slug, description, and various metadata fields. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/tags.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "tags": [ { "id": "5ddc9063c35e7700383b2937", "name": "Getting Started", "slug": "getting-started", "description": "The best place to start exploring Ghost, whether you're a developer, designer, publisher or contributor.", "feature_image": "https://static.ghost.org/v3.0.0/images/feature-image.png", "visibility": "public", "meta_title": null, "meta_description": null, "og_image": null, "og_title": null, "og_description": null, "twitter_image": null, "twitter_title": null, "twitter_description": null, "codeinjection_head": null, "codeinjection_foot": null, "canonical_url": null, "accent_color": null, "url": "https://demo.ghost.io/tag/getting-started/" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MySQL Database in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up MySQL database connection in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": "mysql", "connection": { "host": "127.0.0.1", "port": 3306, "user": "your_database_user", "password": "your_database_password", "database": "your_database_name" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Mailgun SMTP Settings in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up Mailgun as the email service provider in Ghost. This includes transport settings and authentication details to enable email functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "mail": { "transport": "SMTP", "options": { "service": "Mailgun", "auth": { "user": "postmaster@example.mailgun.org", "pass": "1234567890" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Storage Adapter in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for enabling a custom storage adapter in Ghost. The configuration specifies the active storage module name and any configuration parameters required by the module. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/storage-adapters.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` storage: { active: 'my-module', 'my-module': { key: 'abcdef' } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost installation command DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ghost installation process using Ghost-CLI. This will guide you through configuring your site with a series of interactive prompts. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ghost install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Advanced Logging in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive logging configuration including log path, level, rotation settings, and transport methods. This allows fine-tuning how Ghost handles logging for troubleshooting and maintenance. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "logging": { "path": "something/", "level": "info", "rotation": { "enabled": true, "count": 15, "period": "1d" }, "transports": ["stdout", "file"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling SSL for Database Connection in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for enabling SSL connection to the database in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": "mysql", "connection": { "host": "your_cloud_database", "port": 3306, "user": "your_database_user", "password": "your_database_password", "database": "your_database_name", "ssl": true } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Scheduler in Ghost's JSON Configuration DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to configure Ghost to use a custom scheduling adapter instead of the default one. It specifies the name of the custom adapter in the 'scheduling' section of the configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/custom-schedulers.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "scheduling": { "active": "my-adapter" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ghost in Development Mode DESCRIPTION: This command starts Ghost in development mode using Grunt. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` grunt dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Amazon SES Email Service in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration for using Amazon Simple Email Service (SES) as the mail provider. Includes host, port, service designation, and authentication credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "mail": { "transport": "SMTP", "options": { "host": "YOUR-SES-SERVER-NAME", "port": 465, "service": "SES", "auth": { "user": "YOUR-SES-ACCESS-KEY-ID", "pass": "YOUR-SES-SECRET-ACCESS-KEY" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Individual Privacy Settings in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Granular privacy configuration allowing individual control over which privacy-related features are enabled or disabled, including update checks, Gravatar, RPC ping, and structured data. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "privacy": { "useUpdateCheck": false, "useGravatar": false, "useRpcPing": false, "useStructuredData": false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Maximum Privacy Mode in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration to enable 'Tinfoil' mode which disables all privacy-sensitive features at once (update check, Gravatar, RPC ping, and structured data) for maximum privacy protection. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "privacy": { "useTinfoil": true } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ghost Locally DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghost in local development mode after navigating to an empty directory SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/local.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ghost install local ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Amazon RDS SSL Connection in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for enabling SSL connection to Amazon RDS database in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": "mysql", "connection": { "host": "your_cloud_database", "port": 3306, "user": "your_database_user", "password": "your_database_password", "database": "your_database_name", "ssl": "Amazon RDS" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom SSL Certificate for Database in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for using a custom SSL certificate for database connection in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": "mysql", "connection": { "host": "your_cloud_database", "port": 3306, "user": "your_database_user", "password": "your_database_password", "database": "your_database_name", "ssl": { "ca": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIFY... truncated ...pq8fa/a\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost Development Commands DESCRIPTION: These commands are used for various development tasks such as running Ghost in different modes, building packages, and running tests. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` grunt dev grunt dev --server grunt dev --no-server-watch grunt build grunt prod ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Secure Mailgun Connection in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Enhanced Mailgun configuration with secure connection settings, including host specification, port selection, and enabling secure connection for improved security. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "mail": { "transport": "SMTP", "options": { "service": "Mailgun", "host": "smtp.eu.mailgun.org", "port": 465, "secureConnection": true, "auth": { "user": "postmaster@example.mailgun.org", "pass": "1234567890" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SQLite3 Database in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting up SQLite3 database connection in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": "sqlite3", "connection": { "filename": "content/data/ghost-test.db" }, "useNullAsDefault": true, "debug": false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Content Path in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration to specify a custom content path for Ghost. This allows storing content in a different location than the default, with the requirement that the directory structure includes necessary subdirectories. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "paths": { "contentPath": "content/" }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost Setup DESCRIPTION: This command runs the setup process for Ghost, which installs dependencies, initializes the database, sets up git hooks, initializes submodules, and runs the first build of the admin. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn setup ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost in Production Mode DESCRIPTION: Command to start Ghost in production environment using Node.js. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` NODE_ENV=production node index.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Node.js on Ubuntu for Ghost DESCRIPTION: Commands to add the NodeSource repository for Node.js 10 (a supported version for Ghost) and install it system-wide on Ubuntu. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Add the NodeSource APT repository for Node 10 curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_10.x | sudo -E bash # Install Node.js sudo apt-get install -y nodejs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Unix Socket with Custom Permissions in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Extended Unix socket configuration with custom permission settings. This allows fine-tuning access control for the socket file beyond the default 0660 permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "server": { "socket": { "path": "path/to/socket.sock", "permissions": "0666" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ghost-CLI globally with npm DESCRIPTION: Command to install Ghost-CLI globally using npm. Ghost-CLI is a command-line tool that simplifies the installation and configuration of Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo npm install ghost-cli@latest -g ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ghost to Listen on Unix Socket DESCRIPTION: Alternative server configuration that uses a Unix socket instead of TCP/IP. This approach can offer performance benefits in certain environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "server": { "socket": "path/to/socket.sock" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Ghost Database DESCRIPTION: These commands use knex-migrator to manage Ghost's database, including wiping and populating a fresh database. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` knex-migrator reset knex-migrator init ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MySQL password on Ubuntu 18.04 for Ghost compatibility DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up a password for MySQL on Ubuntu 18.04, which is required for compatibility with Ghost-CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # To set a password, run sudo mysql # Now update your user with this password # Replace 'password' with your password, but keep the quote marks! ALTER USER 'root'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH mysql_native_password BY 'password'; # Then exit MySQL quit # and login to your Ubuntu user again su - ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost Server Tests DESCRIPTION: These commands run various types of tests for Ghost, including unit, acceptance, and regression tests. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` grunt test-all grunt test-unit grunt test-acceptance grunt test-regression grunt test:path/to/test.js grunt lint ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Server Host and Port in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Basic server configuration specifying the IP address and port Ghost listens on for requests. By default, requests are typically routed from port 80 to Ghost by a web server like nginx or apache. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "server": { "host": "127.0.0.1", "port": 2368 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connection Pool in Ghost DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for setting database connection pool limits in Ghost. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "database": { "client": ..., "connection": { ... }, "pool": { "min": 2, "max": 20 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Image Optimization in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable the automatic image optimization that occurs when uploading images to the Ghost editor. By default, Ghost compresses and resizes images for performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "imageOptimization": { "resize": false } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Email 'From' Address in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration to override the default 'from' email address for mail sent from Ghost. This allows setting a custom email address instead of the default publication-based address. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "mail": { "from": "myemail@address.com", } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Admin URL in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Setting a custom URL for the Ghost admin panel. This allows specifying a different protocol or hostname for administrative access while maintaining the standard /ghost/ path. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "admin": { "url": "http://example.com" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Name with Email 'From' Address in Ghost DESCRIPTION: Configuration to set both a custom name and email address for the 'from' field in emails sent from Ghost, improving email recipient experience. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "mail": { "from": "'Custom Name' ", } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Ghost to Latest Master DESCRIPTION: This command updates the entire Ghost project to the latest master branch. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` grunt master ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost with Environment Variables DESCRIPTION: Examples of starting Ghost using environment variables for configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` url=http://ghost.local:2368 node index.js ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` database__connection__host=mysql node index.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ghost Client Tests DESCRIPTION: These commands run client-side tests for Ghost using Ember CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ember test ember test --server ember test -f 'gh-my-component' ember test --launch=chrome ember test -s -f 'Acceptance: Settings - General' --launch=chrome ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning Ghost Repository with Submodules DESCRIPTION: This command clones the Ghost repository with its submodules and changes the working directory to the cloned repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone --recurse-submodules git@github.com:TryGhost/Ghost && cd Ghost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing MySQL database server on Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Command to install MySQL server, which is required as the production database for Ghost. Compatible versions are 5.5, 5.6, or 5.7. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Install MySQL sudo apt-get install mysql-server ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating and configuring directory for Ghost installation DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a directory for Ghost installation, set ownership and permissions, and navigate to that directory. Installing in /root or home/ directories is not recommended. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/ubuntu.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # We'll name ours 'ghost' in this example; you can use whatever you want sudo mkdir -p /var/www/ghost # Replace with the name of your user who will own this directory sudo chown : /var/www/ghost # Set the correct permissions sudo chmod 775 /var/www/ghost # Then navigate into it cd /var/www/ghost ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Debugging Ghost Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to start Ghost with debug logging for configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/config.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` DEBUG=ghost:*,ghost-config node index.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Global Packages for Ghost Development DESCRIPTION: This command installs necessary global packages for Ghost development using Yarn. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn global add knex-migrator grunt-cli ember-cli bower ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Git Remote for Ghost Core DESCRIPTION: These commands rename the origin remote to upstream and add the user's fork as the new origin for the Ghost core repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/install/source.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git remote rename origin upstream git remote add origin git@github.com:/Ghost.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running MySQL Security Installation on Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Command to run the MySQL secure installation tool after initial setup to improve database security. This utility helps configure password requirements, remove anonymous users, disallow root login remotely, and remove test databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/TryGhost/docs/blob/master/content/concepts/server-recommendations.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mysql_secure_installation ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing NGINX web server on Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Command to install NGINX, the web server required for Ghost.
